titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ethel May Gate Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:05

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Includes typescript and holograph manuscripts of Gate's collections of stories and poems for children, including "Punch & Robinetta", "The Fortunate Days", and "Tales from the Enchanted Isles", among others. Other writings include the essay collection "The Harvest of the Years" and individual short stories, poems, novels, and plays, including two acts completing Sir James M. Barrie's unfinished play, "Shall We Join the Ladies?". Also in the collection are actors' annotated copies of many of the plays, a letter from Joan Luxton, a personal reflection concerning Gate's father, and manuscript copies of four nineteenth century songs.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Ethel May Gate Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ethel May Gate Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains literary manuscripts of the English writer Ethel May Gate (1882?-1942). A small number of other papers are also included. The collection is organized into two series, Writings and Other Papers , and spans the dates 1912-1940.

Series I, Writings
, contains two subseries. The first, "Anthologies," includes manuscripts and typescripts for several of the author's collections of children's stories and poems, including Punch and Robinetta , The Fortunate Days , and Tales from the Enchanted Isles , among others, and the essay collection The Harvest of the Years . The second subseries, "Other Writings," includes manuscripts and typescripts of short stories, poems, novels and plays, as well as actors' annotated copies of scripts for many of the plays. Also included is a typescript of two acts completing Sir James M. Barrie's unfinished play, "Shall We Join the Ladies."

Series II, Other Papers
, includes a letter from Joan Luxton, a tally of expenses, a personal reflection concerning the author's father, and copies of four nineteenth century popular songs.

controlaccess.persname: Barrie, J. M. (James Matthew), 1860-1937 ( Shall we join the ladies?)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Writings , is organized into two subseries: Anthologies and Other Writings. Each subseries is arranged alphabetically by title. Individual pieces within anthologies are also arranged alphabetically, with the exception of poetry, which may be found at the end of the anthology in which it appeared.

did.unittitle: Note: This anthology and Punch and Robinetta were originally conceived as one volume. For typescript of this larger, unpublished version See: Punch and Robinetta

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscripts and drafts, including "The Enchanted Isle," "Hard Times," "Under the Ground," and "You and Me." Included also, on the verso of an "Enchanted Isle" draft, is "The Foundling," not published in this anthology, and on the same leaf with "Under the Ground," "The Ball," which was published in her anthology Punch and Robinetta .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For other drafts of "You and Me" and "Under the Ground"

scopecontent.p: Gate's reflections on a dream about her father, who died in 1889

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Songs include "I Remember" [Charles Zeuner, 1830?], "Pestal" by W.H. Bellamy, arranged by C.E. Horn, 1845, "Villikins and his Dinah" [from burlesque by F. C. Burnand], 1855, and "The Songs of Long Ago; air: Auld Scotia's Sangs, John Thompson"; in grey paper folder with titles on front cover and Miss Gate's name and address inside front cover
